Replies.Reply: Tiny golden wheels and gears turning lazily upon metal rods. Mechanical pieces. Small and intricate. Glittering in the sunlight.
A piece of developing paper is slipped into the tray basin.
Julia leans forward to get a better view of the developing picture. An image is slowly forming -- carousel horses, the vague outlines of poles and children.
The picture has come into view. The carousel. The children laughing as they ride the horses.
Julia takes the picture out of the developing basin.

The twisted remains of a car accident has brought everything to a near standstill. Police are everywhere. An ambulance is parked along the curb, lights flashing.
VICTIM presses a white towel against his thigh. Blood gushes from it. A huge metal ROD sticks out of his leg.
Julia is standing near the entrance. Waiting patiently.
crosses the street in front of them. He's just a yuppie with a cell phone. But Terry stiffens in her seat, watching him suspiciously.
AT THE FRONT DOOR. A STEADY POUNDING. THE BANGING GOES ON FOR A FEW SECONDS AND THEN STOPS DEAD.
STARES BACK AT HER THROUGH THE PEEPHOLE.

LADY stands behind him. Pleading eyes. Dishevelled and caked with grime. She holds up the drooping sleeve where a hand once was.

At the base of the subway wall. Julia reaches down and palms a few metal pieces at the base of the hole.

Julia pulls herself through another opening and finds herself standing in the threshold of a corridor. Both the walls and floor are constructed of crude metal grates and long pipes. Anything could be hiding within. Waiting.
Julia stops at the corridor opening. The strobe light FLASHES within. Clicking.
TO BITS BY AN APPROACHING BART TRAIN.
